item.title: Open Space: How hiking has changed my view of farming
item.dc:creator: Dan Hurring
item.description: With Teddy Metzler of Seeds for Sustainability Friday 15th October, 4pm UK Time / 5pm CET I have started long distance hiking during my time at university and hiked the lenght of New Zealand (3000Km) in 2015/16, Norway (3000km) in 2017 and crossed Australia from South to North (6000km) in 2019. In particular Australia has...
item.content:encoded:
With Teddy Metzler of Seeds for Sustainability

Friday 15th October, 4pm UK Time / 5pm CET

I have started long distance hiking during my time at university and hiked the lenght of New Zealand (3000Km) in 2015/16, Norway (3000km) in 2017 and crossed Australia from South to North (6000km) in 2019. In particular Australia has been a mind changing experience as walking for weeks, month on remote farms the size of small countries in Europe showed me the dilemma with water, but also being one of the highest quality food producers in the world. It is such a controversial land and I believe we can learn more than permaculture from it. Hiking means also learning and it does not matter if you are 20 or 80 years old, it is something for anyone. I want to show the beauty of hiking, nature and share some stories like walking through a burned down rain forest in Tasmania. I recently moved to northern Italy and i am about to start a Hiker`s hostel following the permaculture principles in the Alps. I think many like-minded people/hikers are into permaculture and want to share their story too. I was thinking of talking and showing some pictures for 30 minutes and having time for questions or exchange for another 30 minutes. I would love to hear your story!

Seeds for Sustainability is a company dedicated to sustainability and healthy living offering consulting services, event management, sustainability projects, and we run a school that offers training and courses based on cutting-edge research and industry knowledge. We pursue a blended learning approach, as we believe that both, online and in-person training, are vital. The company was founded in November 2019.
Seeds for Sustainability’s vision is to close the knowledge gap on sustainability practices and provide individuals and organisations with tools, frameworks and method kits in order to realize change. The client thus focuses on training and consulting services. It’s main ambition is to raise awareness and empower individuals and organisations with tools to manage change.

The Zoom link is :

https://us02web.zoom.us/j/2195516054?pwd=WDBqUHRCVit6NW1IT2M5Znk1WEdQZz09

Password: 470437

item.title: Open Space: Rainwater Harvesting
item.dc:creator: Dan Hurring
item.description: With Guilherme Weishar of Ecoativo (Portugal) Sunday 10th October, 4pm UK Time / 5pm CET Water is the most precious resource. With the destabilization of the weather patterns, rain is becoming more scarce and unpredictable. Therefore, finding ways to catch and store rainfall is of the utmost importance. In this session we will explore the...
item.content:encoded:
With Guilherme Weishar of Ecoativo (Portugal)

Sunday 10th October, 4pm UK Time / 5pm CET

Water is the most precious resource. With the destabilization of the weather patterns, rain is becoming more scarce and unpredictable. Therefore, finding ways to catch and store rainfall is of the utmost importance. In this session we will explore the theory of rainwater harvesting according to Brad Lancaster books on the subject and showcase different examples from Portugal.
Main topics:

  • How scarce fresh water truly is
  • Rainwater harvesting principles 
  • Examples from Portugal

Please register for this event:https://forms.gle/dNw6f7zNB8qA2Fky7

Link for this event:https://us02web.zoom.us/j/82961961953

Organization :EcoAtivo is a ecological movement dedicated to the conservation of the planet and all its inhabitants. Our main areas of focus are: environmental education, designing and implementing ecological restoration projects and nature conservation policymaking. This session is offered through a funded project by the Portuguese National Environmental fund (Fundo Ambiental).


Facilitator: Guilherme Weishar was born in southern Portugal. Over the years he has seen this region become increasingly desertified. In 2017 he did a PDC that changed the way he sees the world. He learned about rainwater harvesting during a reforestation project in Velez Blanco, Spain. The reforestation plan included the construction of hundreds of check dams along the gullies of the mountain. Ever since then he has been learning and implementing similar strategies in several locations in Portugal.

item.title: Open Space: The Common Good Balance Sheet to manage regenerative organizational change
item.dc:creator: Dan Hurring
item.description: With Philipp Schuster of Seeds for Sustainability Saturday 16th October, 2pm UK Time / 3pm CET The common good balance sheet is a tool to manage our socio economic impact. But more importantly it is a tool to manage and steer our organizations and projects towards the common good. Knowing that we need to create...
item.content:encoded:
With Philipp Schuster of Seeds for Sustainability

Saturday 16th October, 2pm UK Time / 3pm CET

The common good balance sheet is a tool to manage our socio economic impact. But more importantly it is a tool to manage and steer our organizations and projects towards the common good. Knowing that we need to create regenerative economies and societies, one might ask: How do I do it? The Common Good Balance Sheet is a great tool to make sustainable organizational transformations and engange into a continous improvement process (Kaizen) towards to common regenerative future.

Seeds for Sustainability is a company dedicated to sustainability and healthy living offering consulting services, event management, sustainability projects, and we run a school that offers training and courses based on cutting-edge
research and industry knowledge. We pursue a blended learning approach, as we believe that both, online and in-person training, are vital. The company was founded in November 2019.
Seeds for Sustainability’s vision is to close the knowledge gap on sustainability practices and provide individuals and organisations with tools, frameworks and method kits in order to realize change. The client thus focuses on training and consulting services. It’s main ambition is to raise awareness and empower individuals and organisations with tools to manage change.

item.content:encoded:
With Eric Ydais of Permaculture En Vivarais

Time and Date: Sunday October 10th at 3.30pm until 4.45pm UK Time.

Gestion de l’eau et régénération des sols. De l’intérêt de mieux lire et comprendre nos paysages. A travers les principes et l’éthique de la Permaculture, vous aurez un meilleur aperçu de comment “planter” la pluie dans les sols.

item.title: Open Space: Supermarket Museum – reimagine the future of our food
item.dc:creator: Dan Hurring
item.description: With Klaudia Krynska of AgroPermaLab Foundation During our session, we will take an interactive tour of a provocative and artistic web-doc, the Supermarket Museum: Food Solidarity 2030+ (http://supermarketmuseum.agropermalab.org)./ The project was created by two European collectives and over 30 collaborators – artists and permaculture educators from 5 countries: Poland, Spain, Ukraine, Germany and Czech Republic...
item.content:encoded:
With Klaudia Krynska of AgroPermaLab Foundation

During our session, we will take an interactive tour of a provocative and artistic web-doc, the Supermarket Museum: Food Solidarity 2030+ (http://supermarketmuseum.agropermalab.org)./ The project was created by two European collectives and over 30 collaborators – artists and permaculture educators from 5 countries: Poland, Spain, Ukraine, Germany and Czech Republic and was supported by Warsaw Biennale. Its aim was to build culture of solidarity and food sovereignty in the midst of the lockdown of Covid-19 Pandemic, which altered our ability to communicate, meet and learn from each other, and connect to nature. The Supermarket Museum is an online exhibition full of interesting resources and narratives about the future of our food, that can be used for education, community awareness building and connecting permaculture curriculum to global food situation. The project draws attention to the challenge of the coming food crisis, the fragility of the supermarket monopoly and today’s dominant model of industrial agriculture which undermine the unbreakable pact of trust between societies and ecosystems. We urgently need solutions that enable producing and enjoying healthier food, empower community food production and and healing the planet so it can heal us in turn. That’s why our project consists of two different yet corresponding paths – “Supermarket Museum” that tackles the problem of supermarket culture and second one – “Garden in your hands” which presents successful alternatives to it: agroecology, permaculture or food sovereignty. And it is this second part that we want to devote our speech to. During our online tour through the online map, we will present these new solutions in the field of food-growing and ecological education to inspire educators from around the world to introduce new methods in their work. “The Garden in your hands” path of the web-doc presents variety of ongoing projects that promise sustainable and renewable innovations. Its easy to navigate interface is constructed to raise awareness about these issues. Let’s walk those path together. The project was curated by Agro-Perma-Lab Foundation, Poland and funded by European Cultural Foundation.

Topic: EUPC Open Space: Klaudia Krynska
Time: Oct 16, 2021 03:00 PM London

Join Zoom Meeting
https://us02web.zoom.us/j/82121587940

item.title: Open Space: Transformation with medicinal forest gardening
item.dc:creator: Dan Hurring
item.description: With Anne Stobart of Medicinal Forest Garden Trust Permaculture offers incredible opportunities for the inclusion of healing plants in projects. This session will draw on the experience of creating Holt Wood in Devon, UK, a transformative medicinal forest garden project based on a site with redundant conifer trees. Participants will hear about design issues in...
item.content:encoded:
With Anne Stobart of Medicinal Forest Garden Trust

Permaculture offers incredible opportunities for the inclusion of healing plants in projects. This session will draw on the experience of creating Holt Wood in Devon, UK, a transformative medicinal forest garden project based on a site with redundant conifer trees. Participants will hear about design issues in developing a medicinal forest garden. We will also discuss the potential for self-help and scaling up with advice on further resources.

Event to be held on Zoom at: https://us06web.zoom.us/j/82282031463?pwd=TVh4RTlIbTArY1BqMThZUXBxRUpZUT09

item.title: Open Space: Training leaders in permaculture in a food sovereignty network in Poland
item.dc:creator: Dan Hurring
item.description: With Joanna Bojczewska of AgroPermaLab Foundation AGRO-PERMA-LAB Foundation integrates political and popular education in Agroecology, Permaculture and Food Sovereignty. We develop inter-sectorial trainings for community leaders, activists and educators; develop community research tools and publish audio-visual materials. In this session we will present our three-tier pedagogical approach to combining community-led research, inter-sectorial leaders’ training in...
item.content:encoded:
With Joanna Bojczewska of AgroPermaLab Foundation

AGRO-PERMA-LAB Foundation integrates political and popular education in Agroecology, Permaculture and Food Sovereignty. We develop inter-sectorial trainings for community leaders, activists and educators; develop community research tools and publish audio-visual materials. In this session we will present our three-tier pedagogical approach to combining community-led research, inter-sectorial leaders’ training in the methodology of social movements and pilot projects in a single process-based training programme. We have three examples of trainings we delivered with this methodology: Permaculture Education; Agrocology & Global Agriculture; Community Seed Saving. Every training our participants form a strong multidisciplinary and diverse group, and the primary criteria is that they represent a community or organisation. This way, our trainings over time started to build an inter-generational network of collaborators and organisers within the wider social movement building education methodology.

This is a 30 minute session

Zoom link for session: https://us02web.zoom.us/j/88697309217

item.title: Open Space: Designing for Nature-Culture Edge
item.dc:creator: Dan Hurring
item.description: With Robina McCurdy of Earthcare Education Aotearoa Permaculture design with an emphasis on the functional and subtle edges between nature restoration and human habitat – where the needs of the land and people are reciprocally met. It is practically applied Deep Ecology. Robina will show a range of examples of her work throughout the world...
item.content:encoded:
With Robina McCurdy of Earthcare Education Aotearoa

Permaculture design with an emphasis on the functional and subtle edges between nature restoration and human habitat – where the needs of the land and people are reciprocally met. It is practically applied Deep Ecology. Robina will show a range of examples of her work throughout the world which embody this synthesis of landscape and social design. The ultimate expression of her approach is in conscious eco-village design, from contemporary purpose-built European eco-villages, to retrofitting squatter settlements into places of dignity. This session is about designing for Belonging in the deepest sense possible.

The Zoom information for this session is as follows:

Topic: EUPC Open Space: Robina McCurdy
Time: Oct 16, 2021 11:00 AM London

item.title: Open Space: Garden Design meets Ecology
item.dc:creator: Dan Hurring
item.description: With Anna Locke, author of The Foragers Garden Saturday 9th October, 11.30am Anna Locke will share her top designing tips and gardening shortcuts that empower us to create wildlife friendly & beautiful, healthy & easy to maintain, forager friendly gardens. Whether a new patch or an existing garden, her tried and tested methods will enhance your garden ecosystem with...
item.content:encoded:
With Anna Locke, author of The Foragers Garden

Saturday 9th October, 11.30am

Anna Locke will share her top designing tips and gardening shortcuts that empower us to create wildlife friendly & beautiful, healthy & easy to maintain, forager friendly gardens. Whether a new patch or an existing garden, her tried and tested methods will enhance your garden ecosystem with more and more food, for us and our local species. Join her short talk and Q&A and find out more.

The Zoom link for this event is as follows:-
